palmos

Class SystemFeatures

  • java.lang.Object
    • palmos.SystemFeatures

  • public class SystemFeatures
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines system features we can test for in our device.
    The main feature used will probably be the ROM version so we have provided a method to easily get it, but any Palm or Handspring feature can be determined using the Palm.FtrGet method and these parameters

      • sysFtrNumROMVersion

        public static final int sysFtrNumROMVersion
        ROM Version
        0xMMmfsbbb, where MM is major version, m is minor version f is bug fix, s is stage: 3-release,2-beta,1-alpha,0-development, bbb is build number for non-releases 
         V1.12b3   would be: 0x01122003
 V2.00a2   would be: 0x02001002
 V1.01     would be: 0x01013000
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sysFtrNumCountry

        public static final int sysFtrNumCountry
        International ROM identifier
        Result is of type CountryType as defined in Preferences.h. Result is essentially the "default" country for this ROM. Assume cUnitedStates if sysFtrNumROMVersion >= 02000000 and feature does not exist. Result is in low sixteen bits.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sysFtrNumLanguage

        public static final int sysFtrNumLanguage
        Language identifier
        Result is of untyped; values are defined in Incs:BuildRules.h Result is essentially the "default" language for this ROM. This is new for the WorkPad (v2.0.2) and did NOT exist for any of the following: GermanPersonal, GermanPro, FrenchPersonal, FrenchPro Thus we can't really assume anything if the feature doesn't exist, though the actual language MAY be determined from sysFtrNumCountry, above. Result is in low sixteen bits.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sysFtrNumDisplayDepth

        public static final int sysFtrNumDisplayDepth
        Display depth
        Result is the "default" display depth for the screen. (PalmOS 3.0) This value is used by ScrDisplayMode when setting the default display depth.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sysFtrNumEncoding

        public static final int sysFtrNumEncoding
        Result is the character encoding (defined in TextMgr.h) supported by this ROM. If this feature doesn't exist then the assumed encoding is latin (Windows code page 1252). (PalmOS 3.1)
        See Also:

      • sysFtrNumGremlinsSupportGlobals

        public static final int sysFtrNumGremlinsSupportGlobals
        // Globals for supporting gremlins. This value is a pointer to a memory location that stores global variables needed for intelligently supporting gremlins. Currently, it is only used in Progress.c. It is only initialized on first use (gremlins and progress bar in combination) when ERROR_CHECK_LEVEL == ERROR_CHECK_FULL. (PalmOS 3.2)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int sysFtrNumVendor

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getRomVersion

        public static int getRomVersion()
        Will return the Palm OS version as MMmf where: 
         MM is the major release number. i.e. 3
 m is the minor release number i.e. 2
 f is the bug fix number i.e. 2
        This allows you to do tests like 
        
 if (palmos.SystemFeatures.getRomVersion() >= 0x350) {
    // we have at least version 3.5 of the OS
 }
